intro: Tapinostemma arabicum, commonly known as the Arabian tapinostemum, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to hot and dry climates. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
